sentence: Speaker, Republicans are openly bragging about how the bill kicks  children and the elderly off Medicaid, nutritional assistance, and  more, all to pay for another tax break for wealthy Republican donors.
It rewards billionaires with massive tax breaks.

If Wall Street wanted a tax break, it would get done in a nanosecond.
This Special Order comes together to shine a bright light on the  Republican plan to fund tax breaks for billionaires by making huge cuts  to Medicaid.

One of those wins has been giving  families a tax break when they buy their insurance through the  marketplace to help make their healthcare more affordable.
This proposal gives the top 0.1 percent of income earners  a new tax break worth an average of $180,000.
This is all about  massive and huge tax breaks to billionaires paid for by stealing from  working Americans.

There is no big tax break for the rich, as  they claim over and over.

Billionaires aren't even allowed to be eligible for that tax break, but  the waitress who is working two or three shifts, barely getting by,  making $32,000 a year finally gets a little bit more money.
